name: Gochujang Gumbo
author: Robin Bashinsky
description: A fusion gumbo that's warming and spicy, with big flavor from andouille sausage, garlic, gochujang (Korean chile bean paste), and Fresno chiles.
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups chopped yellow bell pepper (about 1 large)
1/4 pound peeled and deveined raw medium shrimp
2 red Fresno chiles, seeded and minced
instructions: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high. Add sausage, and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, 5 to 6 minutes.
Add onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic, and cook, stirring often, until onion is translucent, 3 to 4 minutes. Increase heat to high.
Add gochujang; cook, stirring often, until vegetables are very tender, 5 to 6 minutes. Add broth; bring to a boil.
Stir in okra and file powder, and cook until slightly viscous, about 5 minutes. Add shrimp, and cook until shrimp are pink and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes.
Stir in vinegar and salt. Spoon into bowls; top with scallions and chiles.
